revised_title: Robert Alexander Frazer: A Life of Science and Adventure
tldr: The article recounts the life of Robert Alexander Frazer, a talented mathematician and scientist who made significant contributions to aeronautics and Arctic exploration. Frazer worked at the National Physical Laboratory, where he conducted research on fluid mechanics and airship design. He also participated in multiple expeditions to Spitzbergen, where he served as a surveyor and mountaineer. Frazer's life was marked by a combination of scientific achievement and adventurous pursuits, including mountain climbing and airship experimentation.
